alert.note: Alert for Chattahoochee; Stewart (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 10 at 9:26AM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Chattahoochee and Stewart Counties through 1015 AM EST... At 925 AM EST, a strong thunderstorm was over Russell County Sports Complex, or 12 miles southwest of Phenix City, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Lumpkin, Cusseta, Richland, Fort Benning/lawson Army Air Fld, Charles, Christopher, Westville, Jamestown/south Fort Benning, Brooklyn, Renfroe, Manta, Omaha, Louvale and Providence Canyon State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
